org.nzdis.micro

Class ClojureConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.ClojureConnector

  • public class ClojureConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    ClojureConnector provides all means to access Clojure code from Java respectively manage agent registration in Clojure.
    Version:
    $Revision: 2.0 $ $Date: 2010/11/14 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Christopher Frantz

        Starts the Clojure base platform upon call to avoid lazy initialization during runtime

        returns the owner agent's Clojure namespace.

      • execInClojureNamespace

        public static java.lang.Object execInClojureNamespace(java.lang.String namespace,
                                                      java.lang.String clojureCmd)
        Executes a given command in supplied namespace. For use from main method of application.
        Parameters:
        namespace - Namespace as String (e.g. "user"). Defaults to "user" if not supplied.
        clojureCmd - Command to be executed
        Returns:
        Object as return

      • execInClojure

        public java.lang.Object execInClojure(java.lang.StringBuffer clojureCmd)
        Executes a given s-expression in Clojure. This method should be used as limited as possible as it initializes the Clojure compiler (which is very inefficient). All statements are executed in current agent's namespace.
        Parameters:
        clojureCmd - S-expression String
        Returns:

      • registerFunction

        public clojure.lang.Var registerFunction(java.lang.String cljFunctionName)
        This function returns a var for a function defined in the Clojure namespace of the agent and returns a reference allowing invocation from Java.
        Parameters:
        cljFunctionName -
        Returns:
        Clojure Var

      • runRoleScript

        public void runRoleScript(java.lang.String roleScript)
        Runs a specified role script (must reside in roleScriptPath) in agent's namespace.
        Parameters:
        roleScript - Role script to be run

      • startConsoleREPL

        public static void startConsoleREPL()
        Starts a console REPL. Should be started after all initialization procedures, especially network REPL (network REPL does not start after console REPL has been started).

      • startNetworkREPL

        public static void startNetworkREPL()
        Starts the network REPL on the default TCP port (10000).

      • startNetworkREPL

        public static void startNetworkREPL(java.lang.String tcpPort)
        Starts the network REPL with a user-defined TCP port.
        Parameters:
        tcpPort - String definition of TCP port (e.g. 10001)

      • getTcpPort

        public static java.lang.String getTcpPort()
        Returns the TCP port used for the Clojure network REPL.
        Returns:

      • setTcpPort

        public static void setTcpPort(java.lang.String tcpPort)
        Sets the TCP port for Clojure network REPL. Change will only have effect before starting network REPL.
        Parameters:
        tcpPort -

      • setCommonAgentScript

        public static void setCommonAgentScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        Sets the name for the script executed by all agents upon initialization. If set this file is used, else the default "commonAgentScript.clj". Ensure to set it before initializing agents. It should reside in the commonScriptPath.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - Script to be executed as default script for all agents

      • setPlatformScript

        public static void setPlatformScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        Sets the platform script name. It is expected to be found in the commonScriptPath (see setCommonScriptPath()).
        Parameters:
        scriptName - Platform script

      • platformScriptStarted

        public static boolean platformScriptStarted()
        Indicates if the platform CLJ script has been executed using.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setApplicationScript

        public static void setApplicationScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        Sets the application script name. It is expected to be in the user directory subfolder appScriptPath ( --> System.getProperty("user.dir")/appScriptPath).
        Parameters:
        scriptName - Application-dependent script

      • applicationScriptStarted

        public static boolean applicationScriptStarted()
        Indicates if the application-specific CLJ script has been executed using.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setPostInitScript

        public static void setPostInitScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        Sets the post initialization script name (e.g. "postInit.clj"). It is expected to be in the found in the appScriptPath.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - String name of the script file name

      • postInitScriptStarted

        public static boolean postInitScriptStarted()
        Indicates if the post initialization script has been executed using runPostInitScript().
        Returns:
        boolean

      • runPostInitScript

        public static void runPostInitScript()
        Runs the post initialization script as a time defined by the implementer. The scripts needs to be defined before using setPostInitScript() and is expected to be in the appScriptPath (application script path).

      • runCLJScript

        public static void runCLJScript(java.lang.String script)
        Runs a user-defined script when called from application code. Not recommended for general use but for special needs. Preferably use runPostInitScript() as no special checks are done and the script is directly executed in the JVM. Path is relative to java userdir (e.g. "customfolder/customscript.clj"). Returned values are not passed through. Use ExecInClojure for that purpose.

      • setCommonScriptPath

        public static void setCommonScriptPath(java.lang.String path)
        defines the relative path (from Java userpath) for CLJ scripts which are of platform-wide use (e.g. common script for each agent (commonAgentScript.clj), platform script (platform.clj)). Defaults to userpath.
        Parameters:
        path -

      • setIndividualScriptPath

        public static void setIndividualScriptPath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the relative path (from userpath) where all individual agent scripts are stored. Please consider to include the final slash (e.g. "scriptPath/"). Defaults to userpath.
        Parameters:
        path -

      • setApplicationScriptPath

        public static void setApplicationScriptPath(java.lang.String path)
        sets the relative path (from userpath) where all application-related scripts (appScript, postInitScript) are stored. Please consider to include the final slash (e.g. "scriptPath/"). Defaults to userpath.
        Parameters:
        path -

      • setRoleScriptPath

        public static void setRoleScriptPath(java.lang.String path)
        sets the role script path (relative from userpath) where role-related Clojure scripts are to be found. If not set, appScriptPath will be assumed. Please consider to include the final slash (e.g. "scriptPath/").
        Parameters:
        path -
